DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Catheter Urethra Post Brachytherapy Remove Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date of the removal of a urinary catheter, insertion of a tube into the tube that is used to expell urine from the body, following brachytherapy, a procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Catheter Urethra Post Brachytherapy Remove Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the removal of a urinary catheter, insertion of a tube into the tube that is used to expell urine from the body, following brachytherapy, a procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Catheter Urethra Post Brachytherapy Remove Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: (KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.:(yoo-REE-thra) The tube through which urine leaves the body. It empties urine from the bladder.:Post; occuring after.:(ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.:No Value Exists:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: (KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.
The tube carrying urine from the bladder to outside of the body.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.
Shift the position or location of; take out of.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
